# objectByApplyingXSLT(at:arguments:)

**Instance Method**

Applies the XSLT pattern rules and templates located at a specified URL to the receiver and returns a document object containing transformed XML markup or an [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSData] object containing plain text, RTF text, and so on.

## Declaration

```swift
func objectByApplyingXSLT(at xsltURL: URL, arguments argument: [String : String]?) throws -> Any
```

## Parameters

- **xsltURL**: An [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURL] object specifying a valid URL.
- **argument**: A dictionary containing [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSString] key-value pairs that are passed as runtime parameters to the XSLT processor. Pass in `nil` if you have no parameters to pass.



## Return Value

Depending on intended output, the returns an `NSXMLDocument` object *or* an [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSData] data containing transformed XML or HTML markup. If the message is supposed to create plain text or RTF, then an `NSData` object is returned, otherwise an XML document object. The method returns  `nil` if XSLT processing did not succeed.

## Discussion



## Transforming a Document Using XSLT

- **object(byApplyingXSLT:arguments:)**: Applies the XSLT pattern rules and templates (specified as a data object) to the receiver and returns a document object containing transformed XML or HTML markup.
- **object(byApplyingXSLTString:arguments:)**: Applies the XSLT pattern rules and templates (specified as a string) to the receiver and returns a document object containing transformed XML or HTML markup.
